column2: R_i = R_f + Î²_i (R_m - R_f) + Îµ_i

column4: Arbitrage Pricing Theory decomposition of expected returns into market and factor components plus alpha.

column4: Backward induction for Bermudan swaption pricing. Optimal exercise decision at each exercise date maximizes immediate exercise value versus continuation value.
Bayesian approach combining equilibrium returns with investor views. Produces stable expected return estimates for portfolio optimization.

column2: ğ”¼[R_i] = R_f + Î²_i (ğ”¼[R_m] - R_f)

column2: Cap(t) = âˆ‘_{i=1}^n Caplet(t T_i)

column2: ğ”¼[R_i] - r_f = Î²_i (ğ”¼[R_m] - r_f)

column2: P(t T) = exp(-âˆ‘_{i=1}^n f_i Î”t_i)
